title: Does this mean Im cursed now?

comments.comment: This era of Pewds is easily my favourite, such comforting vibes.  We really got that good ending, boys.
Can I just congratulate Marzia, as a Vet seeing a 17 year old pug is INSANE, you’ve looked after her so well and it’s clear she’s enjoyed every second you are such a good dog mum ️

Bro the Kanji practice, the fireworks, giving your dogs a great life, chilling during the many colored sunsets .. the way you guys present your lives these days is like meditation.  I'm so enthralled and inspired every time you post a vlog.  Thank you for staying on YouTube.
I came back to this video to see pewds and Maya together. I'm so happy that she had a long happy life.  RIP Maya, hope you, Marzia and Edgar are doing good.
17 years is impressive for any dog, but 17 for a pug? That's just mind blowing. Maya must be having the best life a dog can get for her to live this long.
I'm really digging the direction Pewds has gone with his videos since moving to Japan. They're just so relaxing and low key now
I feel like Felix being with his dogs and showing them here and there throughout the vlog is the most adorable and heartwarming thing.
Seeing Felix winning in life made my eye covered in tears. Those years in gaming, now you're chilling in japan. What a journey.
He could stop anytime he wanted but the fact that he chooses to still share parts of his life with us is so nice ️
As someone who works in the veterinary field to see a pug that is 17 years old and looking so so well my heart is so full <3 You guys are doing incredible for her! Happy birthday Maya! <3
Maya must be the oldest living pug ever. I'm a Veterinarian and seeing a pug live this long is almost unheard of. She must be so well taken care of. Good job to both of you.
The fact that Felix has won in life despite having such humble beginnings gives me hope
"Am I cursed now?" no Felix, having a collab with Pewdiepie is the most luckiest thing
couldn't be more happy with how Felix's channel has evolved, it's so wholesome

Honestly, watching these blogs bring such a comforting feel. Like no matter if i'm having a hard time or anxious, these blogs just... Calm me down and give hope that i can build my life one day in such a way, too. Than you, Pewds, from Amnesia to these vivid blogs, i am so happy for you and Marzia!!
Watching this after Maya's passing today kinda makes Felix's fortune about death seem like a prediction. Sad day today. I hope Felix and Marzia will get through this okay
This channel used to be so energetic and chaotic and now its is so relaxing and soothing. You know what? I love this

I watched Felix in 2015, and I'm 26 now so I don't watch youtube much anymore. But, from time to time I return to his channel to check and see how he is doing. He helped me a lot when I was younger and since I can't thank him personally it's so good seeing him in japan living his dream with his beautiful family, makes me so happy.
Its hard to believe that Maya is actually 17 years old, time goes by so fast

The part where Marzia ducked under the spiders was off the charts. The "nooooope" in her little walk and expression were the definition of priceless. I love spiders by the way, but the moment was perfect. Good jobs pewds that's a remarkable lady!
How has Felix turned so wholesome. It’s nice to just watch people be happy and serene. Life goals.
Legit shed tears about Maya turning 17. I hope she goes on to live many more happy years.
Wasn’t expecting Felix to have such a nice golf swing

It makes me so happy to see Maya’s still around and that they’re all happy and living out their best lives. Going to Japan was truly a beautiful ending for Pewds and Marzia (not really ending tho) they’re happy, living out their dreams, and can be comfortable with their lives and also just do a lot more than before. ️

When he was showing how he was writing the kanji and the way he memorized them by a small story, I was smiling the entire time. I was really interested in how he did it. And when he said I don't know if anyone cares....well I can be considered someone who cares and loved how you learn things ️
I love how supportive Felix is. These two have such a bright vibe to them.  Keep it up
Congratulations to Maya for turning 17, my dog Lucy just turned 16 a few days ago and it's amazing how much energy they still have

i could feel and hear some of marzia’s editing through these vlogs. even though she’s gone from yt herself it is soooo nice to see ‘her’ vids live on. happy for u guys :) thank u marzia for bringing back the nostalgia for this new chapter :p
It's amazing how marzia's face is never in any of these videos but her beautiful grace is omnipresent in them all
This is my most favorite content pewds has ever made. After all these years, I'm happy that this is where his journey has taken him

I loved seeing Felix's Kanji practice! As someone who feels like they are awful at memorizing things, its inspiring to hear how Felix has been able to memorize so many different kinds of Kanji after practicing the craft!

We all care Pewds...about you, Maya, Edgar and Marzia, all of you. I don't even remember how long it has been since the first vid I watched of you, but from the bottom of my heart, thank you man. You are inspiration for all of us. How after everything, you have achieved success. Love you man...Keep winning we are here for you King

I’m fascinated how cinematic this looks. Seems like there’s a lot of passion into documenting these types of trips. It’s great to see Marzia. Ever since she left this platform, it seems as though she’s left a mark in this community. As always, I wish them good luck on whatever future endeavors they dare to pursue.
This is my favorite era of PewDiePie, so inspiring. I could write novels about how inspirational Felix is.
Never watched PewDiePie until he moved to Japan; so interesting to see him exploring the country. Such chill vibes.
watching Felix and Martzia being to finally romanticize their life is therapeutic im happy for them <3

Maya's birthday was so cute. I once knew a pug that lived to be 18 years old, but that is extremely uncommon. It's great to see Maya living so long and still enjoying life.
I love how Felix's channel has evolved over the years and where it has come to. He really feels like he enjoys making this type of content in his retirement, an enjoyment that I think transfers to the viewer.

I lived through Pewdiepie's chaotic times, so I can see Felix in his most blissful times. 
As a subscriber for 11 years, I love this. As someone who is his age, I have loved Pewds throughout the years and I love to grow with him.

You know how a lot of people were saying that Felix wouldn’t last long in Japan? Well, from the point or of view of a fellow foreign resident of 20+ years, I can say he seems to be on the right track so far: trying everything, appreciating the small stuff around him, studying kanji regularly, …etc. That’s not how people who get frustrated and bitter and leave in a hurry act. I think these two are gonna stick around for a while. If I had one bit of advice; I’d just say join a club or something to make Japanese friends. (Taiko?)

And Felix, if you three ever head down west as far as Mie prefecture, stop by and say hi!
i havent watched pewds in a while, but coming back to this video gave me such heavy emotions. This dude online has really been in my life for 10 years, its crazy to think about. Love this
You were like a big brother to me growing up. I am really happy to see you living the life you once dreamed of
Refreshing to see someone who made it online and doesn’t have to flex on their YouTube audience for the rest of their life
Felix just appreciating little things like food and praising decorations gives me all the serotonin TWT

Coming back to this video later, that fortune was spot on and what’s even more interesting was the fact that it broke, showing that it was not a fortune that was meant to mended, it was simply the time for it and the fortune was just a warning
It's fun to see pewds just have fun, chill, study and just do whatever he wants
Man this is so wholesome and heartwarming.  This is PewDiePie in his actual prime just living his best life

As a Cantonese speaker myself who are born in studying Chinese character (they write similar as Kanji in Japan), actually really impressed with Pew's effort on learning them. 
They are difficult to write and especially difficult to memories their meaning at some point. 
Respect!
This is one of the best videos Pewds has ever made honestly. So relaxing, and beautiful;, can see Marzia's aesthetic editing skills in there, too. Love this.
This definitely feels like a new era for you two (well 4) and it's just so positive and I love seeing Marzia's touch in the filming, music, and editing! Really enjoying the vlogs
The shots he takes, together with the music and the editing, make a great atmosphere.

rips a bad fortune
proceeds to go to a horror movie setting
A true gigachad indeed

Saw someone comment from the previous japan vlogs that its like they lived happily ever after but we get to watch it. Ever since seeing that comment each vlog made me smile even more— and appreciate it even more, love their family even more. Just thinking of all the things they had to deal with in the past, it brings such comfort seeing how happy they are today.

Can't believe Maya is 17 years old now, happy birthday Maya! <3

Anyway, good vlog as always pewds! So happy you have so much fun time now.
It’s crazy to see how much we’ve seen Felix grow and change. I enjoy seeing them in this part of their lives! Also the older he gets the more he looks like his dad (especially with glasses) lol
The fact that Felix is living his best life makes me unfathomably happy for him AND he's still choosing to share it with us is heartwarming. <3
Watching this warms me up in the inside calms my anxiety down. Thank you Felix for sharing your life with everyone!
I love seeing felix just relaxing
What a GREAT video. Been watching for like a decade and this my absolute favorite style of pewds so far. Just very relaxing to view. Cheers mate

Honestly, i haven’t seen any of your videos for like 4 year or so. And i just randomly got this video on my feed and decided to watch it, and im glad i did. You seem really happy and peaceful with yourself and where you are today, and im very happy for you! I wish i can find that peace and happines for myself in a few years.

You also look great!

You probably wont even see this comment! But anyways.

Love from Sverige.
Seeing Maya chow down on that cake warms my heart. You can tell the years are getting to her, but she still absolutely loves cake.
Watching Maya eat her cake and  being her  bday really made me cry, I can't believe they threat their dogs like their own babies  keep making more vlogs
These vlogs have been nothing but bliss

16:53 But off course people care! The way you are documenting your transition to Japan and integrating there seems very personal and is fascinating to me, the process of learning the language is a huge part of that. I have nothing but respect for your devotion and discipline, I find it inspiring!
rest in peace maya we will miss you ️
Felix went from "WHATS UP GUYS MY NAME IS PEWWWDIEPIAAA" to "Konichiwa ore no tomodachi" its a beautiful evolution
Love seeing how happy their life is now that they finally got to move to Japan. These vlogs are just super comforting for some reason and very serotonin inducing
The overall vibe Felix exudes through these videos is downright therapeutic.

i started tearing up when he showed hes kanji learning process lmao idek why im so happy for him djfhsdkfhsdkf i think its cuz ive seen him go through so much bs over the years and grind so much to push out videos now im happy seeing him happy instead
0:18 that's what HE said.
21:21 he nailed the pronunciation, I’m proud of him

i'm actually really interested in his process learning Kanji, i've been working on learning Japanese for the last few months and know around 200 so far and it's been great being able to translate some of the things i see in these vlogs and can imagine how awesome actually being there while learning would be to put it all into context and use them daily.
I'm behind on videos but learning Japanese as an Australian. I love the insight to your learning and the advice you give around it!
Seeing them living their life to the fullest, enjoying every day to the max and just living so peacful makes me so happy, not a single gaming video from pewds could do <3

4:38 I love that Pewds and Marzia decided to try Maimai
such a fun game

I really appreciate the way you retired. I’ve been watching your videos since I was 12 (now 22) and I appreciate that you didn’t just quit. You just slowly left and still post whenever you feel like it. It doesn’t feel like I lost a friend cause I know you’re happy, so even if you do stop it’ll be a good end to 10 years of a one sided friendship lol. I just remember feeling so sad when Jenna Marbles left which is silly but you watch these people grow and don’t want them to leave on bad terms. Thanks for being a friend….

As a Japanese, when I see you experiencing Japan's natural environment of rainy season, hot and humid summers, storms, typhoons, and earthquakes,...I feel that you are a member of the same crew as I am of the ship Japan.
His uploads are so therapeutic these days
i love how we'll never grow old of his content because its growing up with us, love the content
pewds and marzia live better lives than every billionaire

"Am i cursed now"
Proceeds to tear it again
Well now you are cursed 2.0


Maya is the cutest birthday girl ever!
5:35 Edgar actually nodded yes  He’s probably asking for treats after Pewds taught him that trick lol
I'm totally in love with these Japanese vlog videos! They're so peaceful and heart warming :) Watching them always brightens up my mood and makes me really happy!
Randomly decided to sit back and watch all the Pewds vids that I missed all these years. Happened to stop at this one and watching it on Halloween xD
Watching these blogs makes me feel like I too will one day have a chill peaceful life like this. Thanks Pewds

Pewds I want to thank you for posting vlogs even though you're retired. for many years it's been a great source of entertainment to tune in to your vids, and through all the hard times it's been a real comfort to see your journey. I'm a stranger to you, but you've been a "friend" to me. best wishes

I fkn love how youve done everything for the bros for so many years, and now youve found your peace with doing what u want. And still 70K bros watch u within 30 minutes of releasing a vid. Youve deserved every thing you have man. So much love from this day 1 bro
I’ve never felt more at peace when watching vlogs. I love this; can’t get enough of it.
19:07 I watch for the plot
We need a "Pewdiepie Japan Vlogs The Movie" Where Felix takes the best moments of his vlogs and puts them all into a movie

I've been here since amnesia times (around 2011) and I feel so good seeing Felix and his family evolve over the years :) I loved every part of it, but these relaxing vlogs are the top for me since 2011 <3

This video feels like a hug. Thank you for continuing to share little bits of your story with us  been watching since I was 13 and I'm turning 23 in about a week. Thank you for everything! And Happy birthday to the princess!

I really love these Japan vlogs. They are all so relaxing and it feels so nice to see how your life in Japan is going. 
Sweet and belated happy birthday to dear Maya! Stay strong and well cutie pie!
And learning Japanese Kanji is really like that. Historically, they did came from real-life imitations which is why most of them look like faces or objects. Job well done with your Kanji learning! It's not easy but it definitely is not boring.
Hoping for more vlogs~
Well wishes!
So happy to see you, Marzia and the dogs having a great time in Japan. A bit jealous!
Honestly Japan vlogs is one of my favoutite eras of Felixs channel its just so real, crazy to look back on it all and think how a person evolves over what has been, 10+ years?
After all the chaos that has been Pewd’s YT career, it seems kind of fitting that he gets to ride into the sunset and live the life of his dreams. Keep doing you, Felix.

Hey Pewds! Glad to see you're still enjoying Japan so much and that your Kanji study is coming along. Just a word of warning: I've seen a lot of people who learn Kanji via just the meaning really struggle later on when learning the Kun-yomi and On-yomi. Do what works best for you, but you may want to make a side note on your Anki cards with both readings, just so you can start making mental side notes for them.

I just moved to Japan about 5 days ago. Your video’s definitely inspired me to move here a lot sooner than anticipated. Watching your videos back home made feel so excited wanting to explore the country like this. I’m still in shock watching your videos and thinking to myself I can actually just step outside and do the same now. Thanks Felix!
I like how he loves that places are not crowded like they usually are but now I bet there will eventually be so many more people traveling to Japan because of his videos.
Marzia editing absolutely slaps. Max cosy aesthetic

07:00 is so magical. I would watch hours of this type of content

Edit: damn just saw that i have been floor gang for 4 years and 2 months

I'm not feeling great lately due to personal reasons but seeing pewds and marzia living their lives so happy and blissfully is such a cure for me. Felix's videos have always made me smile no matter what's happening and I enjoy every minute of it. I can't wait to live like them someday
Your videos are soo relaxing, it’s a good refresher from all the fast and heavily edited content nowadays
なんだか嬉しい気持ちになりました日本に来てくれてありがとう！
happy birthday to Maya, really happy to see shes 17 now, you are taking a good care of her, my dog had 19, whising both Maya and Edgar to eat more delicious cakes each year <3

These videos are getting artsier and artsier as time goes on. It seems like you two have gotten into a cool groove with how to document what you do. Very cool, peaceful lens to watch a vlog through. I’m excited to see this evolve even more!

動画を見るたびに、どんどんマルツィアが好きになっていきます。
彼女の優しい雰囲気がとても好き。
マヤ、お誕生おめでとう！

What an iconic and W human. I remember subbing at 21 mil just cuz 21 mil was just insane to see around 2010. Never really got into pew but he’s always been there and one of the few faces of YouTube. Hope you and the girl doing good! He’s living in Japan now too isn’t he? One of the coolest places on this planet
Aw, I almost teared up seeing Maya eating that cake. Can't believe she's 17 years old now.  So many wonderful memories from your videos. Wish you 4 the best of luck.

4:55
They usually have that game at the local anime convention I go to each year. My favorite game they bring is still probably Sound Voltex though.

I came for screaming pewds in a pink tutu and stayed for japanese aesthetics.

Please more of these vlogs <3
Maya eating her birthday cake and singing happy birthday to her is just such a wholesome moment, honestly could’ve cried 🥹🥹️
Your recent vlogs makes me want to cry. I love to visit Japan one day, it's my lifelong dream to live in Japan and fall in love with its beauty, especially on the countryside.
Glad to see japan's treating you well pewds. much love <3
Learning chinese characters for 3 years, but Felix's method of studying really inspires me
Just a little correction on 16:13, it should be ’賓‘ instead. Great video btw:)

Last time I watched his videos was around 2013-2015. As a cringy teen, all those lets plays meant so much to me :') 
I'd say watching his videos back then even improved my english, cause it's not my native language. And now at age 24 coming back to his channel, seeing these heartwarming videos feels so comforting ️
5:00  real gamer instinct
It feels like I am watching a well written slice of life anime. Man over the years growing up watching this guy and seeing Felix and Marzia this way and this happy is downright therapeutic.
Also, Maya looks so happy & so does Edgar. The birthday cafe was super cute! Your little family is so lovely~
Dude ngl I'd love to hear more of your kanji process! It's really interesting how you visualize it! More please!
